page.title: 01Gazetteer Heltor Dartmoor
page.content: Located in the{Dartmoor National Park} between Dunsford and Moretonhampstead, this is a rural area of a mixture of moorland, farm and woodlands dominated by the steep sided wooded{Teign valley {gorge}of the upper reaches of the River Teign. A main road, the{B3212, passes through the southeast corner of the block and is heavily used, particularly in summer by tourist traffic visiting the Dartmoor National Park or travellers to Cornwall avoiding the bottle necks on the A30 to Cornwall. There is a nature trail going up the river valley and a{National Trust}area, mainly wooded on either side of the main road. One of the prominent features is{Heltor Rock}located in the southeast area. There are four mixed farms, an ancient{cairn circle}and {Wooston Castle Iron Age}fort remains.
